intro: Hedyotis centranthoides f. hirta, commonly known as the hairy Indian cranesbill, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants known for their medicinal properties. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, giving it a slightly rough texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
